awd_titl_txt: Mechanics of Mud Flow and Land Subscience
awd_abstract_narration: The project is to study the                                                     mechanics of mud flows and of land                                              subsidence due to intensive pumping.                                            The non-Newtonian behavior of fluid                                             mud will be studied for diverse flow                                            velocities.  For slow spreading from                                            a point source two horizontal                                                   dimensions will be examined.  For                                               moderate to high flow speeds the                                                instability and the development of                                              waves in a mud layer or an inclined                                             plane will be investigated.  Land                                               subsidence due to intense pumping                                               from isolated pumping regions will                                              be studied for finite soil                                                      deformation and for nonlinear                                                   coupling between drawdown and                                                   compaction which is important for                                               soft and thick aquitards.  The                                                  combined effects of these two                                                   disturbances will be examined.
org_div_long_name: Division of Civil, Mechanical, and Manufacturing Innovation
